DataElement.preferredDefinition: Uncontrollable craving, seeking, and use of a substance such as a drug or alcohol._Biphasic; having two phases._A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins._A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._an ordered reference standard._an ordered reference standard.

Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins._A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._an ordered reference standard.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Uncontrollable craving, seeking, and use of a substance such as a drug or alcohol.

Concepts.definition: Physical and/or psychological dependence to any substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: Biphasic; having two phases.:A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.:A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or characterized by two stages or phases.

A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.
A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
